article:
'Language for Specific Purposes (LSP)' has been primarily used to refer to two
areas within applied linguistics:
# One focusing on the needs in education and training One with a focus on
# research on language variation across a particular subject field

LSP can be used with any target language needed by the learners as a tool for
specific purposes, and has often been applied to English ('English for Specific
Purposes', or ESP).

A third approach, content or theme-based language instruction (CBI) has also
been confused with LSP. These several uses of the label of LSP have caused some
confusion internationally.
